description: Google is rolling out a new Workspace feature that requires multiple admins to approve high-risk setting changes to prevent unauthorized or accidental modifications that could reduce security. [...]
title: Google Workspace rolls out multi-admin approval feature for risky changes

description: Researchers have demonstrated the "first native Spectre v2 exploit" for a new speculative execution side-channel flaw that impacts Linux systems running on many modern Intel processors. [...]
title: New Spectre v2 attack impacts Linux systems on Intel CPUs

description: A threat actor is using a PowerShell script that was likely created with the help of an artificial intelligence system such as OpenAI's ChatGPT, Google's Gemini, or Microsoft's CoPilot. [...]
title: Malicious PowerShell script pushing malware looks AI-written

description: AT&T is notifying 51 million former and current customers, warning them of a data breach that exposed their personal information on a hacking forum. However, the company has still not disclosed how the data was obtained. [...]
title: AT&T now says data breach impacted 51 million customers

description: Password reuse might seem like a small problem — but it can have far-reaching consequences for an organization's cybersecurity. Learn more from Specops Software about what IT teams can do to combat the problem. [...]
title: Reusing passwords: The hidden cost of convenience

description: Threat actors are abusing GitHub automation features and malicious Visual Studio projects to push a new variant of the "Keyzetsu" clipboard-hijacking malware and steal cryptocurrency payments. [...]
title: Malicious Visual Studio projects on GitHub push Keyzetsu malware
